title: Auckland community leader tired of telling governments how to combat youth offending
desc: A new Ministry of Justice report has shown that Pacific youngsters before the Youth Court are more likely to be remanded into custody than others.

title: Bengaluru airport chaos: Air India Express flight with 180 passengers stuck for 18 hours; flyers protest
desc: BENGALURU: Chaos erupted at KIA after Nepal-bound passengers were stranded for over 18 hours following repeated diversions of an Air India Express fli.

title: Luci4 Had 'Erratic Behavior' at LAX Night Before Death, Cops Tell Family
desc: Up-and-coming rapper Luci4 was found dead in an L.A. residence on Sunday ... and now we're learning more about his movements hours prior to his death.

title: Powell, Heat's leading scorer, sidelined by groin injury
desc: All-Star guard Norman Powell is sidelined with a groin injury and will be re-evaluated in a week's time.

title: Rent tops £1,000 a month in more areas - find out where
desc: The cost of renting privately has surged in the last five years, but tenants may now see a slowdown.

title: Mexico Area Presidency Invites Prayer and Fasting for Peace and Harmony
desc: The Mexico Area Presidency of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints has invited Church members to dedicate their fast on March 1, 2026, to peace and social harmony in Mexico.

title: Ballon d'Or 2026 Power Rankings: Kane Remains On Top; Haaland Back to His Best
desc: GOAL's Ballon d'Or Power Rankings continue to track the likeliest winners of the Golden Ball over the coming weeks and months.

title: Student Remains in Honduras After ICE Vows to Deport Her Again
desc: Any Lucia López Belloza was deported by mistake. A judge ordered her return by Friday. When the Trump administration sent a plane, she decided not to get on.

title: Federal prosecutors in Luigi Mangione case won't appeal ruling that took death penalty off the table
desc: Federal prosecutors signaled in a letter to the court Friday they would not appeal.

title: Claudia Winkleman's new BBC chat show bans chavvy clothes for the audience as rules are revealed
desc: The presenter's programme will launch on screens from Friday, March 13 at 10.40pm and tickets are already on sale for a seat in the crowd.
